body_html: @martinwicke I'd rather keep this simplified one as a temporary measure (until the two PIP packages are at parity) than refactor the main setup.py with a bunch of conditional flags that we're eventually not going to need. Does that make sense?
body_text: @martinwicke I'd rather keep this simplified one as a temporary measure (until the two PIP packages are at parity) than refactor the main setup.py with a bunch of conditional flags that we're eventually not going to need. Does that make sense?
body: @martinwicke I'd rather keep this simplified one as a temporary measure (until the two PIP packages are at parity) than refactor the main `setup.py` with a bunch of conditional flags that we're eventually not going to need. Does that make sense?
